description:
When it comes to music players, Linux offers a hugely impressive range to choose from. From evaluating everything out there, I’m still of the opinion that Tauon Music Box is the finest open-source solution, although fooyin is snapping at its heels. As the software reaches its 10th anniversary, Tauon has released a new edition with […]

The post Tauon Now Releases Its 10-Year Development Anniversary Edition appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Tauon Now Releases Its 10-Year Development Anniversary Edition

description:
NethSecurity 8.0 is a robust Linux firewall with new features, including MultiWAN, DPI filter, enhanced threat protection, and more.

The post NethSecurity 8.0 Open-Source Linux Firewall Released appeared first on Linux Today.
title: NethSecurity 8.0 Open-Source Linux Firewall Released

description:
Transmission 4.0.6, an open-source, free, and cross-platform BitTorrent client, is out as a bugfix-only release in the 4.0.x series, addressing various issues reported by users from previous versions.

The post Transmission 4.0.6 Open-Source BitTorrent Client Released With Various Fixes appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Transmission 4.0.6 Open-Source BitTorrent Client Released With Various Fixes

description:
The new Mobifree initiative fights Big Tech with ethical mobile software that respects privacy, labor standards, and the environment.

The post Mobifree’s Open-Source Strategy Challenging the Tech Giants appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Mobifree’s Open-Source Strategy Challenging the Tech Giants

description:
Unfortunately, Linux 6.8 is not an LTS (Long Term Support) branch, and it has reached end of life, as renowned Linux kernel developer and maintainer Greg Kroah-Hartman announced today with the release of Linux 6.8.12 (the last update in the series), urging users to move to the latest Linux 6.9 kernel branch.

The post Linux Kernel 6.8 Reaches End of Life, Users Should Upgrade to Linux Kernel 6.9 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Linux Kernel 6.8 Reaches End of Life, Users Should Upgrade to Linux Kernel 6.9
